name: rngo0rid
params: class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4
body: |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, crngo), wcel(c1, c2)), wceq(co(c1, c3, c4), c1))

stmt.origin: sylan(wcel(c0, crngo), wcel(c1, c2), wceq(co(c1, c3, c4), c1), wcel(c3, cgr))
stmt.pretty: sylan(c0 ∈ RingOps, c1 ∈ c2, (c1[c3]c4)= c1, c3 ∈ GrpOp)

body.origin:
|- wi(wa(wcel(c0, crngo), wcel(c1, c2)), wceq(co(c1, c3, c4), c1))
-| wi(wcel(c0, crngo), wcel(c3, cgr))
-| wi(wa(wcel(c3, cgr), wcel(c1, c2)), wceq(co(c1, c3, c4), c1))
body.pretty:
⊢ ((c0 ∈ RingOps ∧ c1 ∈ c2)→(c1[c3]c4)= c1)
⊣ (c0 ∈ RingOps → c3 ∈ GrpOp)
⊣ ((c3 ∈ GrpOp ∧ c1 ∈ c2)→(c1[c3]c4)= c1)

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(wa(wcel(c0, crngo), wcel(c1, c2)), wceq(co(c1, c3, c4), c1))

-| wi(wa(wcel(c3, cgr), wcel(c1, c2)), wceq(co(c1, c3, c4), c1))
cumulated.pretty:
⊢ ((c0 ∈ RingOps ∧ c1 ∈ c2)→(c1[c3]c4)= c1)
⊣ (c0 ∈ RingOps → c3 ∈ GrpOp)
⊣ ((c3 ∈ GrpOp ∧ c1 ∈ c2)→(c1[c3]c4)= c1)

body.origin:
|- wi(wcel(c0, crngo), wcel(c3, cgr))
-| wceq(c3, cfv(c1st, c0))

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(wa(wcel(c0, crngo), wcel(c1, c2)), wceq(co(c1, c3, c4), c1))
-| wi(wa(wcel(c3, cgr), wcel(c1, c2)), wceq(co(c1, c3, c4), c1))
-| wceq(c3, cfv(c1st, c0))

body.origin:
|- wi(wa(wcel(c3, cgr), wcel(c1, c2)), wceq(co(c1, c3, c4), c1))
-| wceq(c2, crn(c3))
-| wceq(c4, cfv(cgi, c3))

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(wa(wcel(c0, crngo), wcel(c1, c2)), wceq(co(c1, c3, c4), c1))
-| wceq(c3, cfv(c1st, c0))
-| wceq(c2, crn(c3))
-| wceq(c4, cfv(cgi, c3))
cumulated.pretty:
⊢ ((c0 ∈ RingOps ∧ c1 ∈ c2)→(c1[c3]c4)= c1)
⊣ c3 =(1st ` c0)
⊣ c2 = ran(c3)
⊣ c4 =(GId ` c3)

comment: The additive identity of a ring is a right identity element. (Contributed by Steve Rodriguez, 9-Sep-2007.) (New usage is discouraged.)
